value: This small elevation, created with earth from the defensive ditches of Pintia, allows for a view of the recovery of the funerary landscape of Las Ruedas. From here, one can see both the current cemetery to the south (sashas) and the ancient Vaccean and Roman cemetery to the north (zamanis). A sculpture by Felipe Rodr√≠guez ('Pipe') featuring a cross and a triskele symbolizes the duality of Christian and Celtic traditions. Unfortunately, one of the three plots of the ancient cemetery is still under agricultural cultivation.
